DOC.brief_summary: The study aim evaluate pharmacological effect different α-antagonists phenylephrine induce pupil size healthy male volunteer pharmacological basis Intraoperative floppy iris syndrome ( IFIS )
DOC.brief_title: Study Assess Influence Three Different α-antagonists Placebo Extent Weekly Phenylephrine-induced Mydriasis Three Different Concentrations Phenylephrine Healthy Male Volunteers
DOC.criteria: Healthy male Age ≥ 21 ≤ 55 year Body Mass Index ( BMI ) ≥ 18.5 ≤ 29.9 kg/m2 Signed date write informed consent accordance Good Clinical Practice ( GCP ) local legislation Any finding medical examination ( include blood pressure , pulse rate Electrocardiogram ( ECG ) ) deviate normal clinical relevance Gastrointestinal , hepatic , renal , respiratory , cardiovascular , metabolic , immunological hormonal disorder Diseases central nervous system ( epilepsy ) psychiatric disorder neurological disorder History orthostatic hypotension , faint spell blackouts Chronic relevant acute infection History allergy/hypersensitivity ( include drug allergy ) deem relevant trial judge investigator Intake drug long halflife ( > 24:00 hour ) within least one month less ten halflives respective drug enrolment study study Use drug might influence result trial seven day prior enrolment study study Participation another trial investigational drug ( ≤ two month prior administration trial ) Smoker ( > 10 cigarette > 3 cigar > 3 pipes/day ) Inability refrain smoke inhouse trial day Alcohol abuse ( > 60 g/day ) Drug abuse Blood donation ( ≥ 100 mL within four week prior administration trial ) Any laboratory value outside clinically accept reference range Excessive physical activity within last week trial trial The following exclusion criterion special interest study : Hypersensitivity alpha agonist , phenylephrine Supine blood pressure screen systolic < 110 mmHg diastolic < 60 mmHg Ophthalmological criterion : Corrected visual acuity < 0.5 Refractive Error spherical equivalent > +6 small 6 D Elevated intraocular pressure ( high 22 mmHg ) Relevant anisocoria pupil deformation History eye surgery apart laser trabeculoplasty less three month previously extraocular surgery strabismus surgery Topical ocular medication influence IOP ( intraocular pressure ) pupil size within 3 month prior studystart
